alert.note: Alert for Northern Saratoga; Northern Warren; Southeast Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 25 at 3:47AM EST until January 26 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Northern Saratoga, Northern Warren and Southeast Warren Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall will be in the higher terrain west of Glens Falls and Saratoga Springs. Snowfall rates could be near an inch per hour late this afternoon and evening. Snow will mix with or change to sleet and freezing rain late this evening into tonight before temperatures rise above freezing late tonight.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Northern Saratoga; Northern Warren; Southeast Warren
